title: What is SLA, SLI and SLO's?

title: Why we dont like TDD: A Developer’s Perspective
description: Test-Driven Development (TDD) is a software practice emphasizing writing tests before code. Many find drawbacks in committing to an API prematurely and hindering exploration during early development.

title: How to configure MetalLB with Kubernetes (Microk8s).
description: MetalLB is a load-balancer implementation for bare metal Kubernetes clusters, using standard routing protocols. Learn how to configure MetalLB with Kubernetes (Microk8s).

title: How moving from AWS to Bare-Metal saved us $230,000 /yr.
description: How technologies like Docker, Kubernetes, Helm, Microk8s, Ceph and more make transitioning to bare-metal infrastructure significantly easier than it was just a few years ago.

title: Why build open-source DataDog?
description: Building an open-source alternative to Datadog enhances cost-efficiency, observability, and data privacy, offering a net-positive impact on the software world.

title: Monitoring LLM Application(s) with Openlit and OneUptime
description: How to monitor LLMs using tools like Openlit & OpenTelemetry to ensure accurate outputs, improve data retrieval, and optimize costs, with OneUptime for visualizing performance metrics.

title: How to name spans in OpenTelemetry?
description: Here's how to craft meaningful span names that enhance your observability efforts, making debugging and performance tuning a breeze. From best practices to advanced strategies, this guide covers it all.

title: How to increase the size of the sending queue in OpenTelemetry Collector?
description: Sometimes your OpenTelemetry Collector might not be able to send all the data to the backend. This is because the sending queue is full. This post will help you increase the size of the sending queue.

title: How to collect internal metrics from OpenTelemetry Collector?
description: Sometimes your OpenTelemetry Collector might not be able to send all the data to the backend. This is because the sending queue is full. This post will help you increase the size of the sending queue.

title: Integrating OneUptime and Slack (and probably Teams)
description: Learn how to use workflows to send messages to Slack when incidents are created or updated.

title: Datadog Dollars: Why Your Monitoring Bill Is Breaking the Bank
description: Have you ever opened your monitoring bill and felt your heart skip a beat? You're not alone. In the world of digital infrastructure, many companies are experiencing sticker shock when they see their Datadog invoices. Let's unpack why your monitoring bill might be breaking the bank and explore how you can rein it back in.

title: The Power of Three: How Small Teams Drive Big Results at OneUptime
description: We have found that keeping teams small and focused isnt just efficient — its transformative. Here is how this approach helped us deliver platforms rivaling the scope of Incident.io, StatusPage.io, and more—all with just two tiny teams.

title: Introducing OneUptime MCP Server: Bringing AI-Native Observability to Your Workflow
description: OneUptime now provides a production-ready Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that gives AI assistants direct access to your observability infrastructure. Create incidents, query logs, manage monitors, and automate operations—all through natural language conversations with AI.

title: OneUptime Embraces Open Standards: Complete OpenAPI 3.0 Specification Now Available
description: OneUptime now provides a comprehensive OpenAPI 3.0 specification covering our entire API surface. This commitment to open standards enables seamless integrations, third-party tool development, and demonstrates our dedication to interoperability in the open source ecosystem.

title: Introducing the OneUptime Terraform Provider: Infrastructure as Code for Complete Observability
description: We're excited to announce the release of the official OneUptime Terraform provider! Now you can manage your entire observability infrastructure as code, from uptime monitors and status pages to incident management workflows and on-call schedules.

title: Native apps had a good run, but PWA has caught up and is the future.
description: Native apps had a good run, but the web has caught up. Here's why PWAs now outperform traditional native app strategies for most SaaS platforms—and why OneUptime intentionally chose a single PWA-first codebase instead of separate iOS and Android apps.

title: Stop Paywalling Security: SSO Is a Basic Right, Not an Enterprise Perk
description: Too many SaaS and open-source products still hide SSO behind an enterprise plan. Here's why SSO, SCIM, and 2FA must be baseline security—not monetization levers—and how OneUptime approaches pricing differently.

title: Logs, Metrics & Traces: A Before and After Story.
description: A journey from firefighting in the dark to calm, data-driven operations by unifying metrics, logs, and traces with OpenTelemetry.

title: Traces vs Metrics in Software Observability
description: Metrics tell you what changed. Traces tell you where. Logs tell you why. How to design each signal intentionally with OpenTelemetry and avoid wasted spend.

title: Why Engineers Should Spend a Day Each Week in Support & Sales
description: Embedding engineers directly into customer support and sales one day a week compounds product quality, empathy, velocity, and credibility with a deeply technical buyer.

title: How to reduce noise in OpenTelemetry? Keep What Matters, Drop the Rest.
description: A practical guide to reducing telemetry noise with OpenTelemetry—curating metrics, tail sampling traces, structured log policies, and SLO-first alerting to surface only what accelerates MTTR.

title: What are metrics in OpenTelemetry: A Complete Guide
description: A comprehensive guide to understanding metrics in OpenTelemetry—what they are, how they work, and how to implement them effectively in TypeScript/Node.js applications with practical code examples.

title: What are Traces and Spans in OpenTelemetry: A Practical Guide
description: A comprehensive, code-heavy guide to understanding traces and spans in OpenTelemetry—how they work, how they relate, and how to instrument real Node.js / TypeScript applications effectively for deep insight and faster debugging.

title: How to Structure Logs Properly in OpenTelemetry: A Complete Guide
description: A comprehensive guide to structuring logs properly in OpenTelemetry—mastering log correlation with traces, effective attribute usage, and implementing structured logging patterns that enhance debugging and observability.

title: Why We Resent Middle Managers (And Why OneUptime Doesn't Have Any)
description: Middle managers have become the organizational equivalent of technical debt—layers that slow everything down without adding clear value. At OneUptime, we've intentionally eliminated middle management in favor of direct leadership and autonomous teams. Here's why this approach drives better results, happier engineers, and faster innovation.

title: The Five Stages of SRE Maturity: From Chaos to Operational Excellence
description: Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) isn't a destination—it's a journey. Most organizations evolve through predictable stages of maturity, from alert-ignoring chaos to perfectly oiled operations that rarely breach error budgets. This post outlines the five stages of SRE maturity and how to progress through them.

title: The Hidden Costs of Dependency Bloat in Software Development
description: Dependency bloat isn't just about bundle size—it's a hidden tax on your development velocity, security posture, and long-term maintainability. Learn why fewer dependencies often means faster, safer, and more sustainable software.

title: What are Error Budgets? A Guide to Managing Reliability
description: Error budgets are a fundamental concept in Site Reliability Engineering that help teams balance innovation with reliability. This guide explains what error budgets are, how to manage them effectively, what to look out for, and how they differ from SLOs.

title: Understanding MTTR, MTTD, MTBF and the Complete Reliability Lexicon
description: A comprehensive guide to essential SRE metrics including MTTR, MTTD, MTTF, MTBF, error budgets, SLOs, and advanced reliability concepts. Learn how to implement metrics-driven reliability practices that go beyond simple uptime measurements.

title: Why 'AI content = bad' is a flawed mindset
description: The knee-jerk reaction to dismiss anything created by AI is fundamentally flawed. Quality should be judged by output, not by origin. When AI helps engineers write better code, produce more content, and eliminate grunt work, the real question isn't "was this made by AI?" but "does this solve the problem effectively?"
